awd_titl_txt: SBIR Phase II:  Predicting Healthcare Fraud, Waste and Abuse by Automatically Discovering Social Networks in Health Insurance Claims Data through Machine Learning
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact/commercial potential of this Small Business Innovation Research (SBIR) Phase I project will usher new Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning (AI/ML) products delivering high accuracy with explainability. Without rationale behind predictions, decision makers can't trust and effectively use AI/ML solutions.  Outcome of R&D through this project would lead to more accurate and faster detection with appropriate explanation of anomalous interactions and recommend effective controls to 1) eliminate billions of dollars of fraud, waste and abuse (FWA) in Health Insurance  markets;  2) lower costs, improve quality and speed of Health Care delivery to consumers; and 3) promote new markets in Personalized Health and Smart Health sector for  emerging Medical Internet-of-Things (IOT) devices and systems, enabling economic growth.  The results of this research are expected to enable the discovery of medical anomaly together with advancing the detection of new types of FWA. The boost in detection accuracy with explanation will save hundreds of millions of dollars. Societal impact includes reduced costs to consumers and taxpayers through better FWA control and advance health outcome through early medical IOT anomaly detection. More broadly, the system is expected to detect possible opioid or substance abuse epidemic cohorts, under/over-medication, advanced alerts for community health anomalies.

The proposed project will extend and generalize a novel machine learning method to solve the Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA) problem in health insurance, coupled with explanatory capability providing rational behind predictions and operationalized in a distributed parallel computing framework for scaling. The technical problem is how to combine relations between entities (e.g., doctors) with their attribute (e.g., a doctor's prescription history). This project advances the state of the art by combining relations between rows in the training data (e.g. doctors) with standard machine learning to improve prediction accuracy while facilitating local explanation. The result is vastly improved prediction accuracy with explainability. Thus, the method uses network information to fill in the gaps of entity information alone and vice versa while facilitating explanation for a test case. This method is expected to significantly improve the ability to detect FWA and pave ways for multi Billion dollars savings, call out IOT-based medical anomaly in advance to improve health outcome and build trust in the predictions for the decision makers through the explanations provided. The team intends to deliver not only the accuracy boost with explainability, but a fully operational system with automated data pipeline, parallel and distributed algorithmic processing framework which can be deployed on a SaaS basis or an enterprise solution.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
Overview:

This research aimed to develop a causally and mechanistically interpretable Artificial Intelligence (AI) platform for Digital Health Applications without extensive data science and software development by users.

We extended Albeado's Cross Functional Artificial Intelligence (AI) platform (PRISM XFI) to accurately predict hidden (prescriber) social network-driven Healthcare Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA) using historical health-insurance claims data, even when training examples of FWA are sparse.

We achieved the highest verifiable True Positive Rate (TPR) (upto 5X improvement with respect to competing methods) validated by the HHS-OIG exclusion list of prescriber convictions.

Subsequent phases focused on commercialization accelerators for our data-driven yet causally explainable AI/ML Digital Healthcare technology. By ingesting expert-defined domain,  systems and process knowledge through simple declaratives and deploying meta-learning, we overcame the limitations of "black box" statistical Machine Learning (ML) models to accelerate digital healthcare solutions in the following domains:

  1. TECP supplemental - Digital Radiology: Extended PRISM XFI to develop a high accuracy (exceeding human experts) Computer Assisted Diagnosis (CAD) for Digital Radiology Systems leveraging computer vision augmented AI models for breast tissue segmentation and lesion analysis techniques.
  2. PRISM enabled our TECP partner to significantly enhance the rapidity and accuracy of breast screening,  improving care access, enhancing health outcomes, and reducing cost.

 

  1. COVID supplemental: Extended PRISM XFI to develop Meta Learning models enabling epidemiologists to predict individual US state level COVID-19 dynamics.  Combining case and mortality data with existing epidemiological models in PRISM XFI meta learning framework, this digital public health solution forecasts the future evolution of the number of detected infections and deaths in each US state.
  2. Comparing non-pharmaceutical intervention (NPIs) scenarios and Counterfactual data (e.g., states where NPIs mandates/compliances were weaker), policy makers can identify demographic and socio-economic factors that cause differences in pandemic outcome and control their trajectory.

 

  1. Phase II R&D:   Achieved highest FWA prescriber socialnetwok prediction accuracy.
  2. Extended to individual healthcare claims level to help commercial insurance and government payers accelerate adoption in their workflow - and catch FWA before they are paid.

 

Intellectual Merit

The projects extended and generalized Albeado?s causally explainable machine learning platform to initially deliver Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA) predictions for health claims, coupled with operating explanations behind predictions. Accelerated for scaling and confidentiality within a distributed modeling framework, it dramatically improved prediction accuracy (2-5X TPR improvement vis-a-vis state-of-the-art competitions) while providing mechanistic explainability and ability to detect anomalous dynamics in FWA - and from very limited example of fraud and abuse (sparse training data). Saves hundreds of millions of dollars in health care cost or speeding up digital radiology scan evaluation while improving health outcomes.

 

Our research advances the state-of-the-art of healthcare AI/ML technology by augmenting structured and unstructured digital health data such as Claims, IOT, Digital Radiology Scans, EHR etc. with domain and system knowledge context, along with quantitative and topological data features using unsupervised machine learning. The resulting data combines information that characterizes system dynamic (state models) in relations between entities in a social network (e.g., discovered between doctors) with information that characterizes the entities (e.g., a doctor?s prescription behavior). Our feature engineering methods use network and stateful information to richly fill the gaps of entity information alone and vice versa.

 

The research also produced novel methods of dimensionality reduction by extracting connectivity and temporal information from multi-partite (entity) multi-graph relationships (e.g., multiple link types between doctors and patients in the FWA solution or radiomics features of lesions and tissue classes) over time. By incorporating network topology and stateful properties as additional features in statistical, system dynamics and meta learning models, we significantly boosted prediction accuracy.

 

In summary, the research complemented Albeado?s development of a fully operational autonomous intelligence with an automated data pipeline, parallel and distributed modeling framework. The commercial products and services can be deployed as AI/ML-as-a-Service for enterprises, on top of any other automation, analytics and machine learning.

 

Satisfying key cybersecurity and confidentiality compliance concerns, both on-premise and cloud installation of PRISM XFI AI appliances have been built to optimize healthcare data governance, operational speed and workflow integration.

 

Broader Impacts

The research resulted in AI/ML products and services which significantly improve the ability to detect FWA engendering multi-billion dollar savings, forecast IOT-based medical predictions in advance to improve health outcomes and build trust and confidence in the AI among decision-makers. The causal explanations provided by the PRISM XFI Autonomous Intelligence in language understood by users in the healthcare domain without needing further analysis/queries will be a key accelerator for market adoption and benefit propagation.

 

PRISM XFI platform will improve and accelerate Digital Health Systems, Process and Business outcome across product and service deployment, operation, optimization lifecycles. Customers can achieve significant efficiency and acceleration in multiple organizational functions such as Testing and Trialing before launch, Continuous Optimization, Operational Issue Resolution, Forecasting well in advance for actionable intervention and other Experimentations for Digital Health Applications.

 


Last Modified: 01/25/2022
Modified by: Partha Datta Ray

Images (1 of )
  • Left: Synthesized prescriber social network of suspected (orange nodes) and normal prescribers (green nodes) and type and strength of relationships (links). Right: zoomed to select and isolate specific physicians and find other physicians nearby.
    partha.dattaray@albeado.com
    Copyrighted
    Partha Datta Ray
    PRISM XFI synthesized Healthcare FWA Social Network
  • Propagating historical anomalous behavior labels, synthesized from fraud rank, healthcare claims state and feature space analysis from the bipartite graph connecting prescriber-level models to other entity classes. Main: Suspect/Anomalous prescribers detected in the CMS and PBM datasets.
    partha.dattaray@albeado.com
    Copyrighted
    Partha Datta Ray
    Iterative label propagation to classify suspected FWA behavior
  • Breast tissue segmentation and Tissue type characterization using 3D Digital Tomography: Top Left: Raw data, iterated segmentation and Lump candidates Bottom Left: Region of Interest: Original image and highdensity tissues segmented into lump candidates Right: Tissue type characterization with QTUS
    partha.dattaray@albeado.com
    Copyrighted
    Partha Datta Ray
    Synthesizing 3D Digital Tomography breast scan features and tissue type segmentation
  • Meta-model predictions by observed and counter-factual models for the cumulative number of COVID19 infection predictions between March 2020 to October 2020 for selected US states.
    partha.dattaray@albeado.com
    Copyrighted
    Partha Datta Ray
    Meta learning using counterfactual models for pandemic state predictions
  • Synthesized Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG) explaining the connected dependencies of causal nodes to explain the cumulative difference in number of COVID-19 deaths, March 2020 to October 2020.
    partha.dattaray@albeado.com
    Copyrighted
    Partha Datta Ray
    Causal connection discovery from Pandemic state data from March-Oct, 2020

Overview:

We extended Albeado's Cross Functional Artificial Intelligence (AI) platform (PRISM XFI) to accurately predict hidden (prescriber) social network-driven Healthcare Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA) using historical health-insurance claims data, even when training examples of FWA are sparse.

By ingesting expert-defined domain,  systems and process knowledge through simple declaratives and deploying meta-learning, we overcame the limitations of "black box" statistical Machine Learning (ML) models to accelerate digital healthcare solutions in the following domains:

TECP supplemental - Digital Radiology: Extended PRISM XFI to develop a high      accuracy (exceeding human experts) Computer      Assisted Diagnosis (CAD) for Digital Radiology Systems leveraging      computer vision augmented AI models for breast tissue segmentation      and lesion analysis techniques.
 PRISM enabled our TECP partner to significantly enhance the rapidity and accuracy of breast screening,  improving care access, enhancing health outcomes, and reducing cost.


 

COVID supplemental: Extended PRISM XFI to develop Meta      Learning models enabling epidemiologists to predict individual US state level COVID-19 dynamics.  Combining case and mortality      data with existing epidemiological models in PRISM XFI meta learning      framework, this digital public health solution forecasts the future      evolution of the number of detected infections and deaths in each US      state. 
 Comparing non-pharmaceutical intervention (NPIs) scenarios and Counterfactual data (e.g., states where NPIs mandates/compliances were weaker), policy makers can identify demographic and socio-economic factors that cause differences in pandemic outcome and control their trajectory.


 

Phase II R&D:   Achieved highest FWA prescriber socialnetwok prediction accuracy.
Extended to individual healthcare claims level to help commercial insurance and government payers accelerate adoption in their workflow - and catch FWA before they are paid.

The projects extended and generalized Albeado?s causally explainable machine learning platform to initially deliver Fraud, Waste, and Abuse (FWA) predictions for health claims, coupled with operating explanations behind predictions. Accelerated for scaling and confidentiality within a distributed modeling framework, it dramatically improved prediction accuracy (2-5X TPR improvement vis-a-vis state-of-the-art competitions) while providing mechanistic explainability and ability to detect anomalous dynamics in FWA - and from very limited example of fraud and abuse (sparse training data). Saves hundreds of millions of dollars in health care cost or speeding up digital radiology scan evaluation while improving health outcomes.

By incorporating network topology and stateful properties as additional features in statistical, system dynamics and meta learning models, we significantly boosted prediction accuracy.

 

In summary, the research complemented Albeado?s development of a fully operational autonomous intelligence with an automated data pipeline, parallel and distributed modeling framework. The commercial products and services can be deployed as AI/ML-as-a-Service for enterprises, on top of any other automation, analytics and machine learning.
